bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Chief Librarian, Surgeon-General's Library, July 2, 1941

div1.p: Hench inquires about a book concerning Military Hospital No. 1, in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Chief Librarian, Surgeon-General's Library, July 2, 1941
div1.opener:
July 2, 1941
Chief Librarian
Surgeon-General's Library
Washington, D. C.
Dear Sir: D
div1.p:
Do you have a copy of the following book which I could
borrow on inter-library loan through the Library of the Mayo Clinic:
Memoria del Hospital Numero uno
correspondiente al ano de 1902
por el Medico Director
Dr. Alfredo Valdes Galliol
Habana - Imrrenta Mercantil
Tenniente Rey Numero 12, 1902
Republica de Cuba - Departmento de
Beneficencia. (46 pp and plates)

This concerns The Military Hospital Number One in Havana,
Cuba where was done in 1900 some of the work of the U. S. Army
Yellow Fever Board. Dr. Agramonte especially worked there. Do you
have any other items concerning this hospital?
Enclosed find stamped envelope for your reply.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
